SENT.plain: A 34-year-old woman who had history of repaired tetralogy of Fallot with absent pulmonary valve syndrome presented for transcatheter intervention to reestablish pulmonary valve competence
A 26-mm Edwards Sapien valve was implanted, and coronary angiography after implantation demonstrated no coronary compression
Hemodynamically stable ventricular tachycardia was documented after the procedure
A 12-lead electrocardiogram showed ST segment elevation, and cardiac enzymes were moderately elevated

An echocardiogram demonstrated the stable position of the new pulmonary valve, the marked circumferential hypokinesia of the mid-to-apical left ventricular myocardium, and the normally contracting basal-to-mid myocardial segments
An echocardiogram obtained 4Â days after discharge showed qualitatively improved left ventricular systolic function, particularly in the apical region
